roleset.name: be related to, involved, connected
roleset.note: RELATE-V NOTES: I doubt the active will ever appear. (from relate.01-v)
RELATION-N NOTES: Roleset based on relate.01. No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie (from relation.02-n)
RELATED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on BOLT-1, relate-v.01. Corresponds to VNcls involve-107 (from related.01-j)

example.name: progressive
example.text: ...information relating to fees from clients should be confidential.

example.name: past
example.text: ...a series of initiatives related both to global warming and the plight of the African elephant
example.arg: to global warming and the plight of the African elephant

example.name: active
example.text: John related the performance of the Dow Jones to sunspot activity.
example.arg: the performance of the Dow Jones

example.name: Very common 'in relation to'
example.text: low prices in relation to the company 's earnings per share
example.arg: to the company 's earnings per share

example.name: Family relation
example.text: Ed Turner, no relation to Ted Turner -RRB-

example.name: What to do when the things being compared are in the same node
example.text: The relation between physical education and the economy
example.arg: between physical education and the economy

example.name: both constituents in arg1
example.text: He 's a bit aggressive , raves and rants a lot , and mixes up a lot of different political stances into one bundle when-1 many are in no way related [*-1], but beyond that ....

example.name: args 1, 2
example.text: Even if people show up who you agree with on some political issue , ask yourselves if that issue is actually related to what the protest is about .
example.arg: to what the protest is about

roleset.name: say
roleset.note: RELATE-V NOTES: Frames file for 'relate' based on survey of initial sentences of big corpus (from relate.02-v predicate notes)

example.name: relate as verb of saying
example.text: John related a funny story about his grandmother.
example.arg: a funny story about his grandmother

roleset.name: to know an entity, know/friendship
roleset.note: RELATION-N NOTES: No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie. (from relation.01-n)
RELATIONSHIP-N NOTES: No corresponding verbnet class. Framed by Katie (from relationship.01-n)

role.descr: first party (or all parties, if together)
type of relationship/ reason to know

example.name: Example with arg 1 and 2
example.text: South Korea established diplomatic relations with Hungary in February 1989

example.name: Example with all args
example.text: our excellent working relationship with the Drug Enforcement Administration and the Metropolitan Police Department
example.arg: with the Drug Enforcement Administration and the Metropolitan Police Department

example.name: Example with args 0 and 2
example.text: His long and tortured relationship with Deep Throat

example.name: All args
example.text: It jeopardized her professional relationship with her boss

roleset.name: having a familial relation
roleset.note: RELATED-J NOTES: Added by Julia based on WordNet. (from related.02-j)

example.name: both args, MNR
example.text: It turned out that she was related to him by marriage

role.descr: point of comparison, relative to what/whom?

example.name: all three arguments
example.text: He is fast relative to his peers.
